div2.entryFree: wa * : you say, saAra zayodN waEomorNw, using w as a conjunction; rather than waEamorFA: and sirotu wazayodFA, using w as [a prep.] denoting concomitance; rather than wazayodN. (I'Ak, p. 161.) ― -b2- maA A^um~iY waA^um~uhu; and maA A^anaA waTalabu AlwaHo$i: see A^um~N: and see another ex. in a verse cited voce Halima. In the Kur, ii. 121 some read waA_isom`Eiylu; and others wA_isom`Eiyla. In maA laka wazayodFA, the w denotes concomitance; What hast thou in common, or to do, with Zeyd? or it is for maA laka wialzayoKd. ― -b3- wa in whuwa laka: see HamodN. ― -b4- AlwaAwu limuTolaqi AljamoEi [The w denoting unrestricted conjunction, not necessarily implying simultaneousness nor relative order]. (I'Ak, p. 254.)

waA * generally means Alas! see waA HarabaA, and the last verse voce Hat~aY. ― -b2- waA zayodaAha Alas, Zeyd! ― -b3- waA daforaAho, and waAnitonaAho, Alas, stench! meaning Alas, what an abominable thing! See daforN; and A^abN.

1 waAV^a The verse of Lebeed,
tasolubu AlkaAnisa lamo yuwA^aro bihaA
$uEobapa Als~aAqi A_i*aA AlZ~il~u Eaqalo
means She carries off from the gazelle entering his covert, he not being frightened by her. the branch of the trunk of the tree above him, when the shade contracts, or decreases, or goes away, at midday: he is describing his swift she-camel.

10 Aisotawo'ara *
He hasted in the darkness; as also AstA^wr. (K, art. A^wr.)
1 waA^ala * : see A=la, in art. Awl, in two places.

A^aw~alu *
First, and former; preceding all others, and preceding another. See art. A^wl ― -b2- A^awaAy^ilu Als~uwari The first parts, or beginnings, of the chapters of the Kur-án. ― -b3- jaA='a fiY A^awaAy^ili Alqawomi He came among the first comers of the people. (Msb.) ― -b4- And AlA^awaAy^ilu The people of former ages; as also AlA^aw~aluwna. ― -b5- laqiytuhu EaAmFA A^aw~ala means I met him [in a former year.] before this year, though by several years. (Alee El-Kári, in his Expos. of the K, from Seer; cited in the margin of a copy of the K; art. Awl.) See EaAmN.
3 waA~a^a See art. wmA^.
wiy^aAmN * The being mutually near; mutually agreeing. (T, voce tawo'amN.)
Alt~awo'amaAni * , The herb so called: see art. tA^m.

1 waA^aY * as syn. with waEada; imperative A_ih. with the h of silence added; fem. corroborated form of the imperative A_in~a; of which last, see a curious ex. in the end of article HarofN AlA^alifi, in the Mughnee.
1 wubirati Aln~axolapu * [The palm-tree was fecundated:] i. q. A^ubirato, i. e. A^uloqiHato. (Aboo-'Amr Ibn-El-'Alà, in L, art. A^br.) See art. A^br.

4 A^awobaruwA EalaY $aYo'K *
i. q. AwSbwA Elyh, q. v. (TA, art. wSb.)

naxolapN mawobuwrapN *
i. q. maA^obuwrapN. (Aboo-'Amr Ibn-El- 'Alà, l. e.)

wabo$N *
A whiteness on the nails: see zinojiyr.

1 wabala *
He (a horse) ran vehemently: see an ex. in a verse cited voce daAma, in art. dwm.

wabolN *
Violent rain, consisting of large drops; as also ↓ waAbilN; (K;) a heavy rain.
bulapN * : see A_ibaAlapN.
wabalapN * : see A^abalapN.

wabaAlN *
An evil result. (Msb.)
wabiylapN * : see A_ibaAlapN.
waAbilN * : see wabolN.

waAbilapN * The extremity [in which is the glenoid cavity] of the scapula: and the portion of flesh [or muscle] of the scapula. (IAar, T.) See marodagapN, and also DadafN; and more particularly Ainofaraka.
1 maAwabahotu lahu * , and wabihotu: see maA A^abahotu lh
1 wabuwati AlA^aroDu * and wabiyati AlA^aroDu : see wbiy^at.
4 maA'N laA yuwbiY * : see wbA^.
watarapN * The vein (Eiroq [meaning the frenum]) that is in the inner side (baATin) of the glans of the penis. (S, K, and Zj, in his “ Khalk el-Insán. ”)
mawotuwrN * : see voce vaA^orN.

Alwatiynu * [The aorta: or the aorta descendens:] a certain vein [or artery] adhering to the inner
side of the backbone all along, which supplies all the [other] veins [or arteries] with blood, and irrigates the flesh, being the river of the body: or a certain thick white vein resembling a cane: [this last is the description given by Zj in his “ Khalk el-Insán: ”] or [the aorta ascendens;] the niyaAT of the heart: or a certain white vein within the back of the neck: it is said to draw up [its supply] from the heart, and in it is the blood. ― -b2- Also, the xilob, q. v.: pl. A^awotinapN and wutunN: (M:) i. q. niyaATu Alqalobi. (Bd, and Jel, lxix. 45.) See A^aboharu.
3 waAtaAhu EalaY AlA^amori * , inf. n. muwaAtaApN and witaA='N, i. q. TaAwaEahu; a dial. var. of the verb with ' [i. e. A=taAhu, q. v., and of waATaA^ahu also]. (TA.) See 3 in art. Edw.
4 A^awotaY * : see wat~N.
mstwtY * , or musotawotK A mare desirous of the stallion: see musotaA^otK in art. AtY.

Alt~awaAviyru *
i. q. A^aEowaAnu Alr~ajuli. (TA, in art. Aml.)

1 wavuqa *
It was, or became, firm, stable, fast, or strong; (Msb;) i. q. A^uHokima (S, Mgh, K) [or AisotaHokama, q. v.]. ― -b2- waviqa bihi He trusted, or confided, in him. (S, Mgh, Msb, K.)

4 A^awovaqahu *
He made it firm, stable, fast, or strong. (Msb.) ― -b2- He bound, or tied, him, or it, firmly, fast, or strongly, in a bond. (S, K, TK.) See $ad~ahu.
5 tawav~aqati AlEuqodapu * [The knot became firm, or fast]. (A, in art. Arb.)

10 Aisotawovaqa minohu * [He secured himself against him, by a bond or the like, or absolutely:] he took, or received, a bond (waviyqap) from him. (S, K.) ― -b2- A^ukotubuwhu A@sotiyvaAqFA wadafoEFA liln~izaAEi [Write ye it, (namely, the debt,) for the creditor's self-securing, and for preventing contention]. (Jel, ii. 282.) See AisotaZohara. ― -b3- Aisotawovaqa mina AlbaAbi He closed the door firmly. (MA.) ― -b4- Aisotawovaqa mino A^umuwrihi: see A^aEonaja. ― -b5- Aisotawovaqa mina AlmaAli: see Astwvj. ― -b6- Aisotawovaqa bihi He confided in him.

viqapN *
Trusty; trustworthy; honest: applied as an epithet alike to a man and a woman, and to two or more men or women: pl. viqaAtN. (Msb.) ― -b2- bihi viqatiY In him is my trust, or confidence. (TA.) ― -b3- lasotu minohu EalaY viqapK I am not confident, or sure, of it. Occurring in the S, art. Dmr, &c. See an ex. voce $ahorN (last sentence). ― -b4- A^axuw viqapK: see A^axN. ― -b5- A^axa*a biAlv~iqapi: see A^axa*a, and see my explanation of A_iHotaATa.

Alwaviyqapu fiY AlA^amori *
The doing the thing firmly; and taking the sure method, or way; expl. by A_iHokaAmuhu wAlA^axo*u biAlvi~aqapi. (TA.) ― -b2- waviyqapN A bond, security, or writing of obligation for the payment of a debt or the like: pl. wavaAy^iqu. Ex., kitobapu AlwavaAy^iqi (Bd, ii. 282,) The mode of writing bonds. ― -b3- A pledge. ― -b4- waviyqapN i. q. durojapN, q. v.

A^axa*a AlA^amora biAlA^awovaqi *
He set about the affair in the surest, or firmest, manner. (TA.)
mawoviqN * and ↓ miyvaAqN A compact; a contract; a covenant; an agreement; a league; a treaty; an engagement; a bond; an obligation; a promise. (S, K, &c.)
miyvaAqN * : see mawoviqN; and Jel, &c., in ii. 60 and 87.

mawovuwqN bihi *
In whom [and in which] trust, or confidence, is placed. (Mgh.)
muwav~aqapu Alxaloqi * A she-camel rendered firm, strong, or compact, in make. (S.)

waviymapN *
Broken stones. (TA, art. jrm.) See jaraAmN.

wavanN *
An idol: see SanamN and EavanN and EananN.
wavoYN * : see wavo'N.

1 wajiEa raA^osahu *
He had a pain in his head: see A^alma.

4 A^awojaEahu *
He, or it, pained him; or caused him pain, or aching. (K, MA, TA.)

5 tawaj~aEa *
He expressed, or manifested, pain, affliction, distress, grief, or sorrow; [complained; moaned; or] uttered lamentation, or complaint; (PS;) syn. taA^al~ama. (S, art. A^lm) and tafaj~aEa (S, art. fjE; and K) and ta$ak~aY (Msb, K) and taA^aw~aha (Msb, art. Awh) and A^ah~a (S, art. A^h) and taHaz~ana. (K, art. Hzn.) ― -b2- tawaj~aEa lahu mino ka*aA [He was pained for him, or he lamented for him, on account of such a thing]; he pitied him for such a thing. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b3- tawaj~aEa lilomuSiybapi [He lamented for the affliction, or calamity]. (K, art. fjE.) ― -b4- tawaj~aEa A_ilayohi mn ka*aA He lamented, complained, or expressed pain, or grief, to him, on account of such a thing.

wajaEN *
A disease, or malady, (S, Msb, K, TA,) of any kind, (Msb,) causing pain. (TA.) ― -b2- wajaEu AlmafaASili Pain of the joints; i. e. arthritis: see niqorisN.

jiEapN *
The nby*, or beverage, made from barley: see mizorN.

AlwajoEaA='u *
The anus: see a verse cited voce A^afodaEu.
wajonapN * The ball, or elevated part, of the cheek. (S, Msb, K.)
2 waj~ahoti sijaAfatahu * and sidaAfatahu ; i. e. hatakoti sitorahu, i. e. A^axa*oti wajohahaA: see arts. sjf and sdf, and jwh, conj. 2.

3 waAjahahu * , inf. n. muwaAjahapN, He faced him; confronted him; encountered him; met him face to face (S, K, Msb.) He confronted him, accosted him, or encountered him, with speech, or words, or with his face. (Lth, JK, TA.)

4 A^awojaha *
He repelled, or rejected, an asker, or a beggar. (T.) ― -b2- See jwh.

5 tawaja~ha *
He tended, repaired, or betook himself, to, or towards, him, or it, either in a direct course, or indirectly. (IJ, in M and L, art. qSd.) ― -b2- A^aHomaqu maAyatawaj~ahu A stupid man, who does not accomplish his affair well. (JK.)

8 lamo yat~ajiho li$aYo'K * (S, K, art. bwr; and M, K, art. bld; &c.) He did not apply himself rightly to anything; he knew not the right course to pursue; like lamo yahotadi. See also A^aHomaqu maA yatawaj~ahu; and see baAy^irN and gum~aY. ― -b2- Ait~ajaha lahu raA^oYN i. q. sanaHa. (S, TA.) See sanaHa, in two places. ― -b3- Ait~ajaha A_ilaY AlSiH~api He became convalescent.

wajohN * ― -b2- A^asolamotu wajohiY ll~`h I resigned, or resign, myself to God: i. e., I became, or become, *
Muslim: wjh is here used for the whole because it is the most noble part: (Jel, ii. 106:) or *AtY my course. (TA.) ― -b3- mino kul~i wajohK In every respect; considered from every point of view. ― -b4- Alwajohu A^ano yakuwna ka*aA The [proper or reasonable] way is that it should be thus: or the valid and obvious [way]. (Msb.) See turoEapN. ― -b5- wajohN A course, a purpose, or an object, which one is pursuing; a direction in which one is going or looking, & c. as also ↓ jihapN. ― -b6- The way of a thing. (TA.) ― -b7- layosa likalAamika wajohN There is no truth, or correctness, in thy saying. (TA.) ― -b8- wajohN Brightness [of intellect]. (L, voce kad~N.) ― -b9- liwajohi A@ll~`hi (Kur, lxxvi. 9) For the sake of God; or to obtain the countenance or favour of God. (Kull, p. 378.) See fiY *aAti A@ll~`hi in art. *uw. ― -b10- lawokaAna ka*aA lakaAna wajohFA Were it so, it were reasonable. ― -b11- laA wajoha lahu, said of a phrase, &c., There is no reasonable way of accounting for it. ― -b12- laysa biAlwajohi same as layosa biwajiypK? Not of respectable, or esteemed, or high, authority: (said of a word or phrase, &c.:) or it is not the proper way. ― -b13- AibotigaA'a wajohi All~`hi From a desire of God's recompense: (Kur, ii. 274; and Expos. of the Jeláleyn:) or countenance, meaning favour. There are several similar phrases in the Kur, where wjh is explained in the same sense of vawaAbN in the Expos. of the Jeláleyn. ― -b14- jabasahu Eano wajohihi [He withheld him, or restrained him, from his course, purpose, or object]. (S, art. Alt.) ― -b15- Sarafa Al$~aYo'a Eano wajohuhu He turned the thing away, or back, from its course, Eano sananihi. (TA.) ― -b16- xaraja wajohuhu (S, A, L, art. mrd; and L voce AstElj;) [for xaraja nabaAtu wajohihi, The hair of his face grew forth]. ― -b17- wajohu Ald~ahori The beginning of time, (K,) and nahaArK of day. (TA.) ― -b18- rawaAhu EalaY wajohihi, (S, K, art. qS,) and Had~ava bihi EalaY wajohihi: (Msb, art. qS:) see qaS~a, in two places. ― -b19- A^atayotu AlA^amora mino wajahihi, &c., and ↓ jihatihi: see maA^otFY. ― -b20- wajohN The drift of speech. (K, Kull, p. 378.) ― -b21- maDaYa EalaY wajohihi [He went at random, heedlessly, headlong, or in a heedless, or headlong, course, or manner; and so *ahaba EalaY wajohihi]: see rakiba raA^osahu in art. rkb. ― -b22- dahaba EalaY wajohihi Hayovu $aA='a [He went away at random whither he would]. (TA in art. swm.) ― -b23- bal~ato maTiy~atuhu EalaY wajohihaA and A^abal~ato: see 1 in art. bl. ― -b24- A^uTolubuwA AlHawaAy^ija A_inaY HisaAni Alwujuwhi Make ye petition, for the things that ye want, to persons of good rank or station. (El-Hasan El-Muäddib, in TA, art. nDr.) ― -b25- wajohN (assumed tropical:) Consideration and regard. See 3 in art. Asw. ― -b26- wajohN and ↓ jihapN The place towards which one goes: (Munjid of Kr:) or the place, region, quarter, part, or point, towards which a person, or thing, goes, tends, or is directed: so I have rendered ↓ jihapN: see SuqoEN, and masojuwHN: ↓ jihapN signifies any place towards which one looks or goes; as also ↓ wijohupN: (Har, p. 373:) the place, or point, of the tendency or direction or bearing of anything: whence ka*aA ↓ jihapa in the direction of such a thing: and ↓ lijihapK towards one quarter. ― -b27- Hence, wajohu AlT~ariyqi The point, or place, to which the way, or road, leads: see *anaAbapN. And in like manner, wajohu A^amorK and ↓ jihatuhu The end, or result, of an affair, to which it leads, or tends. ― -b28- ramawoA wajohFA waAHidFA [They shot in one direction]. (M voce ri$oqN.) ― -b29- wajohu AlD~uHaY The first, or beginning, of the DuHaY. (TA voce rawonaqN, q. v.) ― -b30- wajohN A chief of a people or party. (K.) ― -b31- A^atawoA mano wajohihimo: see faworN. ― -b32- wajohN i. q. TariyqapN [meaning The mode, or manner, of a thing]. (KL.) ― -b34- maA A^adoriY maA wajohuhu I know not what is its meaning. ― -b35- A^axa*a wajohahaA [app. He degraded her; took away her grade: and hence he took her maidenhead: see waj~ahoti sijaAfatahu].

jahapN * : see wajohN throughout. ― -b2- mino jihapi ka*aA In respect of, or with reference to, such a thing: and by reason, or on account, or because, of such a thing. ― -b3- AljihaAtu Als~itu The six relative points or directions or locations; namely, above, below, before, behind, right, and left.
wijohapN * : see wajopN. ― -b2- A way, mode, or manner, of acting, &c.

A^awojahu *
More, and most, worthy of regard.
tawojiyhN * : see walovN. ― -b2- Alt~awojiyhu i. q. Alt~aworiyapu.

mutawaj~ahN *
A place towards which one tends, repairs, or betakes himself.

1 wajiYa * and ↓ tawaj~aY [said of a man, or of a horse or the like, or of a camel] His foot, or hoof, or firosin, was, or became, attenuated, and chafed, or abraded: (TA:) or he (a horse) experienced a pain in his hoof. (S.)
5 tawaj~aYa see 1.
muwHajN * : transp. for muwjiHN.
5 tawaH~afa * quasi-pass. of A^atoHafahu: see tuHofapN.
8 Ait~aHafahu A^tHf A^tHfh AtHfh AtHfp tHfY : see art. tHf.
wuHofapN * and wuHafapN, said to be the originals of tuHofupN and tuHafapN: see tuHofapN.
waHalN * (S. Msb, K) and waHolN (Msb, K) Slime, mire, or then mud, (S, Msb, K,) in which beast of carriage slick. (K.)

1 waHamito *
She was incompliant to the male: see an ex. voce $agaba.
HinapN * : see A_iHonapN.

4 A^awoHaY A_ilayohi *
He (God) revealed to him; or spake, or made known, to him by revelation ― -b2- Also, He suggested to him; or put into his mind. (Mughnee voce A^ano.)

waHiY~N *
Hasty; (K;) quick; (S, Mgh, Msb, K; applied in this sense to death. (S, Mgh, Msb.)
AlwaHaA='a AlwaHaA='a * [Make thou] haste; or haste to be first, or before, or beforehand: haste; &c. (S, TA.)

fiY A^awoHaY mud~apK *
In the shortest period: see an ex. in the first paragraph of art. vqf.

1 waxafahu *
He beat it (namely xiTomiY~, IDrd, K, and in like manner sawiyq, IDrd) with his hand, and moistened it in a T$t [or basin], (TA,) until it became viscous, or cohesive, (K, TA,) and became [fit for] food; (TA;) as also ↓ A^awoxafahu (K) and ↓ wax~afahu. (TA.)
2 wax~afa see 1.
4 A^awoxafa see 1.
5 tawax~ama see 10.

10 Aisotawoxamahu *
He found it (food) to be unwholesome; as also ↓ tawax~amahu: (JK, K:) he found it (a land) to be insalubrious: (TA:) he found it (a country or town) to disagree with
its inhabitants. (S, Msb.) ― -b2- maA A^asotawoximu A^ano A^aSoHabaka: see 5 in art. jdb.

waxomN *
A heavy person (K) [i. e., dull].

waxamN *
A tainted condition of the air, engendering pestilential diseases. (TA.)

waxiymN *
Unwholesome food: (Mgh:) unsuitable food. (K.)
3 waAxaAhu * : see A=xaAhu.

5 tawax~aAhu *
He sought it, aimed at it, or purposed it: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) and he sought it, &c., exclusively of, or in preference to, any other thing. (Mgh.)

1 waduEa * , (S, K,) inf. n. wadoEN and daEapN, (TA,) He (a man, S,) or it, (a thing, TA,) became still, quiet, or at rest; (S, K, TA;) as also ↓ Ait~adaEa, (K, TA,) [quasi-] inf. n. tudoEapN and tudaEapN. (TA.) You say to a man, ↓ Ain~adaEo and ↓ tawad~aEo meaning Be thou grave, staid, steady, sedate, or calm. (TA.) See also 1; and art. w*r. ― -b2- waduEa and wadaEa, inf. n. wadaAEapN, He was, or became, in a state of ease, and ampleness of the means or circumstances of life. (Msb.) ― -b3- daEo: see an ex. voce A=*aY: it may be rendered, in different cases, Leave thou, or let alone, or say nothing of: see baloha. ― -b4- daEoniY mino ka*aA Let me alone and cease from such a thing: and exempt thou me, or excuse me, from such a thing. ― -b5- daEo Eanoka ka*aA Dismiss thou from thee such a thing. See xu*o Eanoka. ― -b6- daEo maA yariybuka A_ilaY laA yariybuka: see art. ryb. ― -b7- daEo maA zayodN: see siY~N in art. swY. ― -b8- wadaEa used as a pret.: see an ex. voce zaAy^ilapN, in art. zwl.
2 wad~aEahu * , (MA,) inf. n. tawodyEN, (PS,) He bade farewell to him. (MA, PS.)

3 waAdaEahu * , inf. n. muwaAdaEapN, and subst. widaAEN, He made peace or reconciled himself, with him: (Msb:) [the inf. n.] muwaAdaEapN is syn. with muSaAlaHapN because it is mutaArakapN [a mutual leaving, or leaving unmolested]. (Mgh.) ― -b2- muwaAdaEapN is also syn. with tarokN; as also ↓ daEapN: (TA:) so that waAdaEahu signifies He left him: but more correctly, he left him, being left by him; like taArakahu, and xaAlaAhu; and this is the primary meaning.
5 tawad~aEa see 1.

6 tawaAdaEaA *
They two made peace, or became reconciled, each with the other. (K.)
7 A_inowadaEa see 1.
8 Ait~adaEa * : see 1: he acted, or proceeded, with moderation, without haste or hurry, in his pace or journeying. (M in art. Awn.)

10 AisotawodaEahu maAlFA *
He intrusted him with property; intrusted to him property; gave property to him in trust, or as a deposit. (Msb.) And AisotawodaEahu wadiyEapF He asked him to keep, preserve, guard, or take care of, a deposit. (K.)

daEapN *
Ease; repose; freedom from trouble or inconvenience, and toil or fatigue; tranquillity; syn. xafoDN (S. Mgh, K, TA) and raAHapN (Mgh, Msb, TA) and sukuwnN; (TA;) and ampleness of circumstances (saEapN) in life: (K:) or daEapN is syn. with rAHp and skwn; but xafoDN signifies “ ampleness of the circumstances ” (saEah~N) of life, and “ plentifulness and pleasantness ” thereof: [see an ex. of both, voce xafoDN]. (El-Marzookee and MF, art. xfD.) -A2- See 1 and 3.

wadaEapN *
A cowry; Cypræa: see an ex. cited voce sam~a.

wadiyEapN *
A thing committed to the trust and care of a person; a trust; a deposit. (Mgh, Msb.) See 10.
wadaAEN * [Gravity, steadiness:] i. q. sakiynapN, [like ↓ mawoduwEN,] as also waqaArN. (S, L, in art. skn.) ― -b2- And Valediction. (S, Msb.)
miydaEN * and miydaEapN A garment, or piece of cloth, used as a repository for clothes. (TA.)
mawoduwEN * : see wadaAEN, and see a verse cited voce maSodaq.

musotawodaEN *
A depository: see a verse cited voce Zil~N.

wadoqN *
Rain, (S, K, TA,) whether violent or gentle: (TA:) or violent rain. (MF in art. qhb.)
wadiyqN * : see 10 in art. qrA^.
mutawad~iqN * : occurring in the TA, art. qhb; from Alwadoqu, meaning Violent rain. (MF.)

wadakN *
Grease, or gravy: i. e. the oily matter that is produced from flesh-meat; (TA;) or the dripping that exudes from flesh-meat and from fat. (Mgh, Msb.)
mawoduwnN * : see maToluwlN.

See Bd, vi. 27 and 30. ― -b8- waqafotuhu ElY *anobihi I made him acquainted with, or made him to know, his crime, sin, fault, or the like; (S, K:) and so Ealayohi ↓ A^awoqafahu, q. v. (JK, K. *) ― -b5- tawoqiyfN, as a legal term: see naS~a EalaY $aYo'K m~aA. ― -b6- See 1

Of very frequent occurrence. ― -b3- tawaq~afa Eani AlA^amori (assumed tropical:) He held, refrained, or abstained, from the thing, or affair. (Msb.) ― -b4- tawaq~afa EalaY ka*aA It (for instance, an

He preserved, or guarded, himself exceedingly, or extraordinarily: (Ksh, Bd in ii. 1:) he put a thing between him and another to preserve him, or guard him. Excess of preserving or guarding. (Ksh, Bd in ii. 1.) ― -b2- A preservative.

waAqiyapN * used as an inf. n., like baAqiy~apN: see Har, p. 136. ― -b2- waAqiyapN as meaning one preserver: see an ex. voce baAqiyapN.

Alwahaqu *
The lasso. ― -b2- migolaApN Alwahaqi: see migolaApN, art. glw.

laqiytuhu A^aw~ala waholapK *
I met him the first thing: see SawolapN.

1 wahima fiY AlHisaAbi * , (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) aor. yawohimu, inf. n. wahomN, (S, Msb,) He committed an error, or a mistake, in the reckoning, or calculation; (S, Mgh, Msb, K;) as also fiyhi ↓ A^awohama: (Mgh, Msb:) and committed an inadvertence therein. (S.) [And in like manner, fiY qawolihi in his saying.] It is said in a trad. of 'Alee, A_in~amaA Als~aAdiqu h`*aA ↓ qaAla Al$~aAhidaAni A^awohamonaA or wahimonaA accord. to different readings [The two witnesses said, We have committed a mistake, or misconception: the thief is only this]. (Mgh.) ― -b2- wahamotu Al$~aYo'a, (Mgh, Msb, *) aor. A^ahimu, inf. n. wahomN, (Mgh,) [I thought of the thing;] the thing occurred in my mind. (Mgh, Msb, *) And wahamotu fiY Al$~aYo'i, (S, K,) or A_ilaY Al$~aYo'i, (Msb,) aor. as above, (S, Msb, K,) and so the inf. n., (S, Msb,) I thought of the thing, (S, Msb, K,) while desiring to think of another thing. (S, Msb.)
2 wah~ama see 4.

4 A^awohamahu *
He made him to think [or imagine a thing]; as also ↓ wah~amahu. (S, K.) A^awohamahu ka*aA He made him to think, or suspect, such a thing. (MA.) ― -b2- See 8. ― -b3- A^awohama: see wahima. ― -b4- A^awohama fiyhi also signifies He doubted respecting it. (Mgh.)

5 tawah~ama * is properly rendered He presumed, surmised, fancied, or supposed a thing: and tawah~umFA, upon presumption, surmise, or supposition; and suppositively: see wahomN; and xaAla and xaAlN. ― -b2- tawah~ama He thought; (S, K;) he imagined a thing: (TA:) he doubted: see an ex., in a verse of 'Antarah, cited voce mutarad~amN.

8 Ait~ahamahu bika*aA * (Msb, K) and A^atohamahu bihi (AZ, K) and bihi ↓ A^awohamahu (K) He made him an object of imputation, or suspected him, of such a thing; he imputed to him such a thing. (Msb, K, TA.) See art. thm. ― -b2- A^atohamahu bika*aA, as also Ait~ahamahu bk*A, and bk*A ↓ A^awohamahu, He suspected him of such a thing; i. e., of a thing that was attributed to him. (Marg. note in K.) [This is the signification commonly obtaining. See an ex. in the TA, voce sixaAb. ― -b3- Also, the second, He accused him of such a thing.]

wahomN *
A thought, or an idea, occurring in the mind: (Mgh, Msb, * K: *) pl. A^awohaAmN: (Msb:) or of the two extremes [or different opinions or ideas] between which one wavers, that which is outweighed [in probability]. (K.) An [indecisive] opinion or idea outweighed in probability [or formed from evidence outweighed in probability; a presumption; a surmise; a fancy; a supposition]: opposed to Zan~N, q. v. (Kull, p. 376.) ― -b2- Also Doubt, or suspicion: but for this I have found no authority; though it is well known, and plainly indicated in the Msb, in art. xyl; voce xay~ala, q. v. in this Lex. ― -b3- Also The object of a thought, or of an idea, occurring in the mind. (Mgh.) And The mind itself, or intellect; syn. EaqolN. (MF, TA.) In modern Arabic it signifies An imagination, a fancy, a chimera, and a conjecture.

1 wahana *
He was, or became, weak, or infirm, in an affair, and in operation, and in body; (Msb:) and so said of a bone: (Bd, and Jel in xix. 3:) and he was, or became, languid, languid and faint, or lax in the joints; (TA, Bd in iii. 140;) enervated, unnerved, or broken in energy; (Bd, ubi suprà;) cowardly. (TA, Jel in iii. 140.) ― -b2- See also 4.
2 wah~ana see 4.

4 A^awohanahu *
He, or it, weakened him: [rendered him languid, languid and faint, or lax in the joints; enervated him, unnerved him, or broke his energy; rendered him cowardly: (see wahana:)] (S, Msb, K:) and ↓ wahanahu, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) but the former is the better, (Msb,) and ↓ wah~anahu. (S, K.)
wahonN * The period about midnight; (S, K;) or the time after an hour, or a short period, (saAEap,) of the night: (JK, K, TA:) or when the night is departing. (S.) See A_inoYN.

Eiroqu AlwaAhinapi *
The cephalic vein: see faliyqN.

wahonaAnapN *
I. q. wanaApN, q. v.; and see A^anaApN.

tawah~unN *
Weak, languid, unable to rise: see EudawaA='u.

1 wahaY *
It was, or became, much slit, or rent. (Msb.) ― -b2- It was, or became, lax, flaccid, or flabby: (Msb:) or weak; said of a rope, (Mgh,) or other thing: or it fell. (Msb.) See waAhK. ― -b3- wahaiYa It was, or became, uncompact, unsound, or weak. ― -b4- wahaY A^amoruhu [His affair, or case, was, or became, in a weak, or an unsound, state]. (TA, art.ngD, &c.)

waAhK *
Lax; weak: frail; wanting in strength, compactness, firmness, or toughness; unsubstantial; unsound. See an ex. in the S, voce A^uno$uwTapN, where it is applied to love, or affection. ― -b2- waAhFA: see an ex. voce nugobapN; and see A=hi, in art. Awh, in two places.
wayolapu * and wayolFA lahu and wayolN lahu Woe to him! [See Eawolaka]. Perdition befall him! Punishment befall him! (Kull, p. 377.) See voce wayobN, and voce wayoHN, and wayosN.

wayohFA * [an imperative verbal noun, which may be rendered On!] a word of incitement. (S, K.) One also says to a man, and to a horse, yaA wayohaAho [Ho! On!]. (A'Obeyd in TA in art. Ayh.) See A^ay~aha. ― -b2- wayohaka: see A^ayohaka in art. Ayh. I have not found this anywhere but in that art. in the K, and doubt its correctness.
